title: How much does it take to afk to get banned?
body: Okay so recently my internet has been losing it's shit at the worst of times, seeing as I AFK'd several times since things got in the way and then I wanted to redeem myself by playing a few games. But seeing as my internet keeps cutting out before or mid game I am terrified that if I try again the internet will go out or something and I will get a permanent ban, seeing as I have spent a lot of money ( like everyone who plays league pretty much ) on my account with skins and so on, I don't want to risk losing that. So my question is, is there a way to get rid of your 'bad points' im going to call it. Is there any other way other than playing games and not being a toxic poop or AFKing once more?

replies.body:
>  So my question is, is there a way to get rid of your 'bad points' im going to call it. Is there any other way other than playing games and not being a toxic poop or AFKing once more?

Short answer is no.

If you're afking/leaving games you're going to be picked up by LeaverBuster. 

I totally understand that it's frustrating (I'm currently trying to fix my own disconnection issues at home, ugh) but the solution is to not leave games and to not afk.
Mmm I decided to give it a go today and it started magically working fine as it's normal self again which is great. So I guess LeaverBuster can put me off the radar now. Thank you!
